subject: Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: The United States Olympic Committee reorganized part of its management team, a move that will allow the chief operating officer, Norm Bellingham, more time to focus on starting an Olympic television network sometime in the next few months. When the U.S.O.C. hires a chief marketing officer to replace Rick Burton, who resigned earlier this month, that person will report to the chief executive, Jim Scherr, instead of to Bellingham, who is in charge of developing the network.
